Literature Information.Literature: Discovery: Found in multiple species. Also isolated from atraditionally fermented Chinese meat product (Zhang et al., 2013).Activity: Active against L. sakei subsp. sakei CIP 103139 (MIC 8 nM), E. faecium HKLHS (MIC 256 nM), L. lactis CIP 102422 (MIC 256 nM),  L. mesenteroides subsp. mesenteroides CIP 102305 (MIC 16 nM), L. innocua CIP 80.11 (MIC 256 nM), and L. monocytogenes CIP 82.110 (MIC 512 nM) (Makhloufi KM et al., 2013). The MIC against L. monocytogenes (MIC 6.8 uM) for a synthetic form of pediocin PA-1, similar to the natural form. Also active against E. coli.Plantaricin BM-1 decreases viability of SW480 human colorectal cancer cells by inducing caspase-dependent apoptosis (Wang et al., 2023).SAR:  A linear analog without the two disulfide bonds (Cys9–Cys14 and Cys24–Cys44) was as potent.Structure: The Cys9–Cys14 bond is conserved among the class IIa bacteriocins, as is the N-terminal YGNGV sequence, both features being signatures of this family.
